poem:
Title: "Promises in the Morning Paper"

In the gray fog
of printed promises,
Starmer's words stand -
marked by honour 
or deceit. 

Drawing lines in the shape 
of law and wars,
a craft hidden
in the folds 

of newspaper ink.

Who will weigh 
our arms' sales, tipping 
brittle balances between 
profit and peace?

Words are seeds
sown heavily in print,
Their thorny truth
grown only in action.
